availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, carpenter. Jessamine County, Kentucky, native. Son of Jacob Messick and Annie McConnell Messick. Married to Harriett L. Mitchel Messick. Father of James Messick and Joseph T. Messick. Resident of Jessamine County, Kentucky, in 1850. Carpenter in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, Division 1, p.6B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 638.
"Mathew Messick (1837-1896)," Find A Grave, Memorial #29278877, accessed August 17, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/29278877.
Edmund Janes Cleveland and Horace Gillette Cleveland, The Genealogy of the Cleveland and Cleaveland Families, vol. 1, (Hartford, Connecticut: The Case, Lockwood & Brainard Company, 1899), 2098.
